de.awi.floenavigation.aismessages

Class AISDecodingService

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • android.app.IntentService
            • de.awi.floenavigation.aismessages.AISDecodingService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2

    public class AISDecodingService
extends android.app.IntentService
    An IntentService subclass for handling asynchronous task requests in a service on a separate handler thread. This class is used to handle decoding of AIS messages received from the AISMessageReceiver and on the basis of AIS Message types the packet data is segregated and stored in the internal local database

    TODO: Customize class - update intent actions and extra parameters.

      Stores the received gps time from the GPS_Service

      packet in the form of String received from the AISMessageReceiver Initially it is initialized to null value
      private int packetType
      Message type is stored in the internal database, so that it can be used during initial setup of the grid.
      static int POSITION_REPORT_CLASSA_TYPE_1
      Message type of AIS packet, this corresponds to class A AIS transponders The payload containing this message type contains position related information like lat, lon, sog, cog related to the station fitted with the class A transponder The first 6 bits of the payload are the message type
      static int POSITION_REPORT_CLASSA_TYPE_2
      Message type of AIS packet, this corresponds to class A AIS transponders The payload containing this message type contains position related information like lat, lon, sog, cog related to the station fitted with the class A transponder The first 6 bits of the payload are the message type
      static int POSITION_REPORT_CLASSA_TYPE_3
      Message type of AIS packet, this corresponds to class A AIS transponders The payload containing this message type contains position related information like lat, lon, sog, cog related to the station fitted with the class A transponder The first 6 bits of the payload are the message type
      static int POSITION_REPORT_CLASSB
      Message type of AIS packet, this corresponds to class B AIS transponders The payload containing this message type contains position related information like lat, lon, sog, cog related to the station fitted with the class B transponder The first 6 bits of the payload are the message type
      private PostnReportClassA posObjA
      The payload present in the packet after separated from the packet is decoded and segregated by the class PostnReportClassA for message types POSITION_REPORT_CLASSA_TYPE_1, POSITION_REPORT_CLASSA_TYPE_2 and POSITION_REPORT_CLASSA_TYPE_3
      private PostnReportClassB posObjB
      The payload present in the packet after separated from the packet is decoded and segregated by the class PostnReportClassB for message type POSITION_REPORT_CLASSB
      private double recvdCourse
      This is the decoded course over ground of the station from the payload received
      private double recvdLat
      This is the decoded latitudinal value of the station from the payload received
      private double recvdLon
      This is the decoded longitudinal value of the station from the payload received
      private long recvdMMSI
      This is the decoded MMSI number decoded from the payload received
      private double recvdSpeed
      This is the decoded speed over ground of the station from the payload received
      private java.lang.String recvdStationName
      This is the decoded station name from the payload received
      private java.lang.String recvdTimeStamp
      This is the decoded timestamp from the payload received
      static int STATIC_DATA_CLASSA
      Message type of AIS packet, this corresponds to class A AIS transponders The payload containing this message type contains static information such as vessel name, call sign, part number related to the station fitted with the class A transponder
      static int STATIC_VOYAGE_DATA_CLASSB
      Message type of AIS packet, this corresponds to class B AIS transponders The payload containing this message type contains static information such as vessel name, call sign related to the station fitted with the class B transponder

      Stores the difference between the system time in milliseconds and the received gps time

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void msgDecoding(int msgType, java.lang.StringBuilder binary)
      This function is called from onHandleIntent(Intent) Based on the message type corresponding classes are called to decode the payload Once decoded, local variables are initialized with those values
      void onCreate()
      Initializes and registers broadcast receiver and implements on onReceive onReceive calculates the time difference between the system time and the gps time This is required since the gps time is received after certain interval periodically, this helps in synchronizing the time stamp of the received packets with the gps time
      void onDestroy()
      Broadcast receiver is unregistered in this callback function
      protected void onHandleIntent(android.content.Intent intent)
      This function splits the received packet on the basis of comma and sends the data to be decoded to the AIVDM class After the payload is decoded the required parameters are stored into the corrsponding tables of the internal local database If the received mmsi is present in the DatabaseHelper.stationListTable the decoded payload along with the mmsi is stored in DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable else it is stored in DatabaseHelper.mobileStationTable If there is error in any SQLite Database instructions, the exceptions are handled using try catch exception handlers and appropriate log messages are added.

      • POSITION_REPORT_CLASSA_TYPE_1

        public static final int POSITION_REPORT_CLASSA_TYPE_1
        Message type of AIS packet, this corresponds to class A AIS transponders The payload containing this message type contains position related information like lat, lon, sog, cog related to the station fitted with the class A transponder The first 6 bits of the payload are the message type

      • packetType

        private int packetType
        Message type is stored in the internal database, so that it can be used during initial setup of the grid. During the initial setup after the MMSI number of the station to be installed is entered, the screen transitions to the coordinate fragment only when the positional data report of the AIS station with the entered MMSI is received. The coordinate fragment realizes that a valid positional packet is decoded by the AISDecodingService when it checks and evaluates the packetType which is here stored.
        See Also:
        MMSIFragment, CoordinateFragment, CoordinateFragment.checkForCoordinates()

      • broadcastReceiver

        private android.content.BroadcastReceiver broadcastReceiver
        It is used to receive the broadcasted gps time

      • gpsTime

        private long gpsTime
        Stores the received gps time from the GPS_Service

      • timeDiff

        private long timeDiff
        Stores the difference between the system time in milliseconds and the received gps time

        public AISDecodingService()
        Default Constructor. Used to initialize aivdmObj, posObjA, posObjB, voyageDataObj, dataReportObj

    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate()
        Initializes and registers broadcast receiver and implements on onReceive onReceive calculates the time difference between the system time and the gps time This is required since the gps time is received after certain interval periodically, this helps in synchronizing the time stamp of the received packets with the gps time
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.app.IntentService

      • onDestroy

        public void onDestroy()
        Broadcast receiver is unregistered in this callback function
        Overrides:
        onDestroy in class android.app.IntentService

      • onHandleIntent

        protected void onHandleIntent(android.content.Intent intent)
        This function splits the received packet on the basis of comma and sends the data to be decoded to the AIVDM class After the payload is decoded the required parameters are stored into the corrsponding tables of the internal local database If the received mmsi is present in the DatabaseHelper.stationListTable the decoded payload along with the mmsi is stored in DatabaseHelper.fixedStationTable else it is stored in DatabaseHelper.mobileStationTable If there is error in any SQLite Database instructions, the exceptions are handled using try catch exception handlers and appropriate log messages are added.
        Specified by:
        onHandleIntent in class android.app.IntentService
        Parameters:
        intent - It is used to extract the packet send as an intent extras

      • msgDecoding

        private void msgDecoding(int msgType,
                         java.lang.StringBuilder binary)
        This function is called from onHandleIntent(Intent) Based on the message type corresponding classes are called to decode the payload Once decoded, local variables are initialized with those values
        Parameters:
        msgType - message type of the AIS message
        binary - payload from the packet received in binary format from AIVDM.decodePayload()
        See Also:
        recvdLat, recvdLon, recvdSpeed, recvdCourse, recvdMMSI
